B2 in a way that has a very great effect: He argued powerfully and persuasively against capital punishment.
in a way that has a lot of strength or force: She kicked the ball so powerfully that it flew over the hedge. Klaus is a very powerfully built man. See
powerful

Natural events like this remind us powerfully that life is a fragile thing. It is a powerfully symbolic meeting. I'm amazed at how powerfully my child's small fingers can squeeze mine. Scientists believe that if the volcano erupts powerfully, lava will probably shoot straight up into the air.That means you need to learn to exhale powerfully, which takes strong abdominal muscles.
